subject: Add support for building with meson
commitMessage:
Add support for building with meson

This commit focuses in enabling the meson build for the
phosphor-snmp repo.

This commit includes fixes in the repo:

1. Moving experimental filesystem to filesystem
2. Errors that meson identified
3. Clang-10 issue

To build and install using meson:
  meson build
  ninja -C build
  ninja -C build install

Tested By:
  meson -Dtests=enabled build
  ninja -C build test

Signed-off-by: asmithakarun <asmitk01@in.ibm.com>
Change-Id: I8d9c59f60f19eb99df1526caee09a367b7662ec7

Patch Set 8:

I have pushed the changes over there..https://gerrit.openbmc-project.xyz/c/openbmc/phosphor-snmp/+/49356
IMO none of these should really be configurable.  I realize they were before but to simplify things you could just hardcode all these in config.h.
Do you have access to docker?  I suggest running the same environment as the OpenBMC CI and just drop support for cross compiling unit tests.
why is this not a dependency?

The reference manual of meson (https://mesonbuild.com/Reference-manual.html) specified:

"Objects created with dependency or find_library (for external deps) or declare_dependency can be put under `dependencies`.

One or more shared or static libraries (built by this project) that this target should be linked with should be mentioned in "link_with". The arguments can also be custom targets."

So here, libsnmp is a shared library and hence I included it in "link_with" arg.

should be >= right ?
other wise it break once poky moves beyond that version.

do you also want to enable lto as well ?

and also please untab the file
probably need a comment, as to why we need this , just for future reference as this flag is not present in the configure.ac.

Referred it from the commit for enabling meson for bmcweb. It says 'It suppresses the # of Note messages during cross-compilation'

But anyway, in this repo, I tested without this flag and there were no such messages and hence I will remove it in my next patchset
is this not enforced by werror=true ? can you check ?
Yes, this error is being enforced in one place. Hence added this flag to suppress the same.
redundant ?, you can use it directly right ?

not needed since c++17,can you see if we have an experimental::filesystem and then migrate them to std::filesystem ?

so we can remove this dep.
Yup. Moved 'em and removed this dependency. Will push my next patchset
all the other things looks okay to me, but should this come from meson_options ?
Since this option is made configurable in the Autotools, I am moving this to the meson_options file.

it should be either char** argv or char* argv[] , not both ?

i would suggest a new commit prior to this commit with these changes alone.
this is clang-10 issue. is the clang-10 not run ?

this depenedency is not required.

use can use dependency gtest with a flag to get the main for gtest as far as i know.
Yes, adding an attr 'main: true' in the gtest would do. Removed it!
do you want to sort thse files in any way ?
I dont see any header files in test directory , do we need this ?
It should go on to to test/meson.build.
'sdbusplus' pulls in systemd since it needs systemd directly.So we can remove this.
